intro: Oreogrammitis raiateensis, commonly known as the Raiatea fern, is a rare and endemic species native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like fronds that are typically dark green with a slightly curled appearance. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on rock surfaces or in moist, shaded forest areas. Its spores are released from small, clustered sporangia located on the underside of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oreogrammitis raiateensis is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
